alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Effingham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Chatham and Effingham. In southeast South Carolina, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Godley Station, Savannah International Airport, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Downtown Savannah, Hutchinson Island, Rincon, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Hardeeville, Bloomingdale, Meinhard, Monteith, Meldrim, Eden, Savannah Historic District, Williams, Tutens and Hamer.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
